intro: Glossodia major var. alba, commonly known as the white glossodia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, and it is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and minimal water.
